TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Image extends Microsoft.Azure.Management.Media.Models.Video

Docs.summary: Describes the basic properties for generating thumbnails from the input video

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Public Sub New (Optional label As String = null, Optional keyFrameInterval As Nullable(Of TimeSpan) = null, Optional stretchMode As Nullable(Of StretchMode) = null, Optional start As String = null, Optional step As String = null, Optional range As String = null)

new Microsoft.Azure.Management.Media.Models.Image : string * Nullable<TimeSpan> * Nullable<Microsoft.Azure.Management.Media.Models.StretchMode> * string * string * string -> Microsoft.Azure.Management.Media.Models.Image
MemberSignature.Usage: new Microsoft.Azure.Management.Media.Models.Image (label, keyFrameInterval, stretchMode, start, step, range)

Docs.param: An optional label for the codec. The label can be used to control muxing behavior.

The distance between two key frames, thereby defining a group of pictures (GOP). The value should be a non-zero integer in the range [1, 30] seconds, specified in ISO 8601 format. The default is 2 seconds (PT2S).
The resizing mode - how the input video will be resized to fit the desired output resolution(s). Default is AutoSize. Possible values include: 'None', 'AutoSize', 'AutoFit'

The position in the input video from where to start generating thumbnails. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT05S), or a frame count (For example, 10 for the 10th frame), or a relative value (For example, 1%). Also supports a macro {Best}, which tells the encoder to select the best thumbnail from the first few seconds of the video.

The intervals at which thumbnails are generated. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT05S for one image every 5 seconds), or a frame count (For example, 30 for every 30 frames), or a relative value (For example, 1%).

The position in the input video at which to stop generating thumbnails. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT5M30S to stop at 5 minutes and 30 seconds), or a frame count (For example, 300 to stop at the 300th frame), or a relative value (For example, 100%).
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Image class.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Range : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the position in the input video at which to stop generating thumbnails. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT5M30S to stop at 5 minutes and 30 seconds), or a frame count (For example, 300 to stop at the 300th frame), or a relative value (For example, 100%).

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Start : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the position in the input video from where to start generating thumbnails. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT05S), or a frame count (For example, 10 for the 10th frame), or a relative value (For example, 1%). Also supports a macro {Best}, which tells the encoder to select the best thumbnail from the first few seconds of the video.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Step : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the intervals at which thumbnails are generated. The value can be in absolute timestamp (ISO 8601, e.g: PT05S for one image every 5 seconds), or a frame count (For example, 30 for every 30 frames), or a relative value (For example, 1%).
